posts._title: Mariano Cohn & Gastón Duprat – El Artista aka The Artist (2008)
posts.title: El Artista
posts.excerpt: SynopsisJorge (Sergio Pángaro), a 40-year-old man, single, shy and circumspect, works as a nurse in a geriatric house. There, he looks after Romano (Alberto Laiseca), an old man who hardly walks and does not speak, with a special attention.Jorge regularly keeps paper rolls with drawings. With Polo’s help (Diego Perdomo), a photographer neighbor of his, …

posts._title: Julien Duvivier – Sous le ciel de Paris AKA Under the Sky of Paris (1951)
posts.title: Sous le ciel de Paris
posts.excerpt: Quote:Fates of multiple otherwise disconnected characters intertwine miraculously under the sky of Paris. And it all happens in one day.

posts.title: Afskåret
posts.excerpt: 19-year-old Sarah is going on holiday deep in the Swedish forests with her parents. Everything seems to be completely idyllic, but just as she leaves behind civilisation and mobile phone coverage, she discovers that a sex tape of her has been shared on the internet. Without a connection to the outside world, it is difficult …

posts._title: Ming-liang Tsai – He liu AKA The River (1997)
posts.title: He liu
posts.excerpt: Quote:An unemployed young man named Hsiao-Kang (Lee Kang-sheng) passes idle time at a local Taipei mall when he encounters an old friend (Chen Shiang-chyi) on the opposite escalator. With time on his hands, he agrees to accompany her back to the location shoot where she is working as a production assistant for a film. At …

posts._title: Ali Badrakhan – al-Gou’ AKA The Hunger (1986)
posts.title: al-Gou’
posts.excerpt: A cinematic masterpiece produced by the revolutionary 1960s generation inspired by the folk hero myths of Nobel Prize Laureate Naguib Mahfouz. Based on his 1977 novel about the Egyptian ‘urban rabble,’ The Harafish, the film portrays the rise of a people’s hero and his rapid corruption through power. Although set in the late 19th century, …

posts._title: Danièle Huillet & Jean-Marie Straub – Schwarze Sünde (1990)
posts.title: Schwarze Sünde
posts.excerpt: This is the Straubs’ film of Hüolderlin’s third attempt at Empedokles’s death.

posts.title: Sad Vacation
posts.excerpt: Kenji, abandoned by his mother, scrapes out a meager existence doing odd jobs including driving bar hostesses and their customers home. Besides this he takes care of the sister of an old friend in jail and a young illegal immigrant. But his life reaches a turning point when he happens to meet Chiyoko, his long …

posts.title: La légende dorée
posts.excerpt: Collector of cursed musicians, unreasonable murderers, fairground freaks, paranoid revolutionaries, flatulists and suicidal hermits, a psychiatric patient presents a gallery of the historic figures he is haunted by.

posts._title: Kalender Hasan – Tecahül-i Arif AKA About Arif (2016)
posts.title: Tecahül-i Arif
posts.excerpt: SynopsisArif with Down syndrome has only one purpose in his life: dancing with a woman. But, all of the his neighbors know that Arif lives in an imaginary world.

posts._title: Christos Gkotsis – To Taksimo AKA The Pledge (2014)
posts.title: To Taksimo
posts.excerpt: A man lives isolated on an island. His only companion is a young woman with whom he has made an unnatural agreement: She pretends to be his deceased wife. What happens when the pledge is broken?
